001package squidpony.squidgrid;
002
003import java.awt.Point;
004import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
005import java.util.Set;
006
007import squidpony.squidmath.Point3D;
008import squidpony.squidmath.RNG;
009
010/**
011 * Basic radius strategy implementations likely to be used for roguelikes.
012 *
013 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
014 */
015public enum Radius {
016
017    /**
018     * In an unobstructed area the FOV would be a square.
019     *
020     * This is the shape that would represent movement radius in an 8-way
021     * movement scheme with no additional cost for diagonal movement.
022     */
023    SQUARE,
024    /**
025     * In an unobstructed area the FOV would be a diamond.
026     *
027     * This is the shape that would represent movement radius in a 4-way
028     * movement scheme.
029     */
030    DIAMOND,
031    /**
032     * In an unobstructed area the FOV would be a circle.
033     *
034     * This is the shape that would represent movement radius in an 8-way
035     * movement scheme with all movement cost the same based on distance from
036     * the source
037     */
038    CIRCLE,
039    /**
040     * In an unobstructed area the FOV would be a cube.
041     *
042     * This is the shape that would represent movement radius in an 8-way
043     * movement scheme with no additional cost for diagonal movement.
044     */
045    CUBE,
046    /**
047     * In an unobstructed area the FOV would be a octahedron.
048     *
049     * This is the shape that would represent movement radius in a 4-way
050     * movement scheme.
051     */
052    OCTAHEDRON,
053    /**
054     * In an unobstructed area the FOV would be a sphere.
055     *
056     * This is the shape that would represent movement radius in an 8-way
057     * movement scheme with all movement cost the same based on distance from
058     * the source
059     */
060    SPHERE;
061
062    private static RNG rng = null;//lazy instantiation
063    private static final double PI2 = Math.PI * 2;
064    public double radius(int startx, int starty, int startz, int endx, int endy, int endz) {
065        return radius((double) startx, (double) starty, (double) startz, (double) endx, (double) endy, (double) endz);
066    }
067
068    public double radius(double startx, double starty, double startz, double endx, double endy, double endz) {
069        double dx = Math.abs(startx - endx);
070        double dy = Math.abs(starty - endy);
071        double dz = Math.abs(startz - endz);
072        return radius(dx, dy, dz);
073    }
074
075    public double radius(int dx, int dy, int dz) {
076        return radius((float) dx, (float) dy, (float) dz);
077    }
078
079    public double radius(double dx, double dy, double dz) {
080        dx = Math.abs(dx);
081        dy = Math.abs(dy);
082        dz = Math.abs(dz);
083        double radius = 0;
084        switch (this) {
085            case SQUARE:
086            case CUBE:
087                radius = Math.max(dx, Math.max(dy, dz));//radius is longest axial distance
088                break;
089            case DIAMOND:
090            case OCTAHEDRON:
091                radius = dx + dy + dz;//radius is the manhattan distance
092                break;
093            case CIRCLE:
094            case SPHERE:
095                radius = Math.sqrt(dx * dx + dy * dy + dz * dz);//standard spherical radius
096        }
097        return radius;
098    }
099
100    public double radius(int startx, int starty, int endx, int endy) {
101        return radius((double) startx, (double) starty, (double) endx, (double) endy);
102    }
103
104    public double radius(double startx, double starty, double endx, double endy) {
105        double dx = startx - endx;
106        double dy = starty - endy;
107        return radius(dx, dy);
108    }
109
110    public double radius(int dx, int dy) {
111        return radius((double) dx, (double) dy);
112    }
113
114    public double radius(double dx, double dy) {
115        return radius(dx, dy, 0);
116    }
117
118    public Point onUnitShape(double distance) {
119        if (rng == null) {
120            rng = new RNG();
121        }
122
123        int x = 0, y = 0;
124        switch (this) {
125            case SQUARE:
126            case CUBE:
127                x = rng.between((int) -distance, (int) distance + 1);
128                y = rng.between((int) -distance, (int) distance + 1);
129                break;
130            case DIAMOND:
131            case OCTAHEDRON:
132                x = rng.between((int) -distance, (int) distance + 1);
133                y = rng.between((int) -distance, (int) distance + 1);
134                if (radius(x, y) > distance) {
135                    if (x > 0) {
136                        if (y > 0) {
137                            x = (int) (distance - x);
138                            y = (int) (distance - y);
139                        } else {
140                            x = (int) (distance - x);
141                            y = (int) (-distance - y);
142                        }
143                    } else {
144                        if (y > 0) {
145                            x = (int) (-distance - x);
146                            y = (int) (distance - y);
147                        } else {
148                            x = (int) (-distance - x);
149                            y = (int) (-distance - y);
150                        }
151                    }
152                }
153                break;
154            case CIRCLE:
155            case SPHERE:
156                double radius = distance * Math.sqrt(rng.between(0.0, 1.0));
157                double theta = rng.between(0, PI2);
158                x = (int) Math.round(Math.cos(theta) * radius);
159                y = (int) Math.round(Math.sin(theta) * radius);
160        }
161
162        return new Point(x, y);
163    }
164
165    public Point3D onUnitShape3D(double distance) {
166        if (rng == null) {
167            rng = new RNG();
168        }
169
170        int x = 0, y = 0, z = 0;
171        switch (this) {
172            case SQUARE:
173            case DIAMOND:
174            case CIRCLE:
175                Point p = onUnitShape(distance);
176                return new Point3D(p.x, p.y, 0);//2D strategies
177            case CUBE:
178                x = rng.between((int) -distance, (int) distance + 1);
179                y = rng.between((int) -distance, (int) distance + 1);
180                z = rng.between((int) -distance, (int) distance + 1);
181                break;
182            case OCTAHEDRON:
183            case SPHERE:
184                do {
185                    x = rng.between((int) -distance, (int) distance + 1);
186                    y = rng.between((int) -distance, (int) distance + 1);
187                    z = rng.between((int) -distance, (int) distance + 1);
188                } while (radius(x, y, z) > distance);
189        }
190
191        return new Point3D(x, y, z);
192    }
193    public double volume2D(double radiusLength)
194    {
195        switch (this) {
196            case SQUARE:
197            case CUBE:
198                return (radiusLength * 2 + 1) * (radiusLength * 2 + 1);
199            case DIAMOND:
200            case OCTAHEDRON:
201                return radiusLength * (radiusLength + 1) * 2 + 1;
202            default:
203                return Math.PI * radiusLength * radiusLength + 1;
204        }
205    }
206    public double volume3D(double radiusLength)
207    {
208        switch (this) {
209            case SQUARE:
210            case CUBE:
211                return (radiusLength * 2 + 1) * (radiusLength * 2 + 1) * (radiusLength * 2 + 1);
212            case DIAMOND:
213            case OCTAHEDRON:
214                double total = radiusLength * (radiusLength + 1) * 2 + 1;
215                for(double i = radiusLength - 1; i >= 0; i--)
216                {
217                    total += (i * (i + 1) * 2 + 1) * 2;
218                }
219                return total;
220            default:
221                return Math.PI * radiusLength * radiusLength * radiusLength * 4.0 / 3.0 + 1;
222        }
223    }
224
225
226    private int clamp(int n, int min, int max)
227    {
228        return Math.min(Math.max(min, n), max - 1);
229    }
230
231    public Set<Point> perimeter(Point center, int radiusLength, boolean surpassEdges, int width, int height)
232    {
233        LinkedHashSet<Point> rim = new LinkedHashSet<Point>(4 * radiusLength);
234        if(!surpassEdges && (center.x < 0 || center.x >= width || center.y < 0 || center.y > height))
235            return rim;
236        if(radiusLength < 1) {
237            rim.add(center);
238            return rim;
239        }
240        switch (this) {
241            case SQUARE:
242            case CUBE:
243            {
244                for (int i = center.x - radiusLength; i <= center.x + radiusLength; i++) {
245                    int x = i;
246                    if(!surpassEdges) x = clamp(i, 0, width);
247                    rim.add(new Point(x, clamp(center.y - radiusLength, 0, height)));
248                    rim.add(new Point(x, clamp(center.y + radiusLength, 0, height)));
249                }
250                for (int j = center.y - radiusLength; j <= center.y + radiusLength; j++) {
251                    int y = j;
252                    if(!surpassEdges) y = clamp(j, 0, height);
253                    rim.add(new Point(clamp(center.x - radiusLength, 0, height), y));
254                    rim.add(new Point(clamp(center.x + radiusLength, 0, height), y));
255                }
256            }
257            break;
258            case DIAMOND:
259            case OCTAHEDRON: {
260                {
261                    int xUp = center.x + radiusLength, xDown = center.x - radiusLength,
262                            yUp = center.y + radiusLength, yDown = center.y - radiusLength;
263                    if(!surpassEdges) {
264                        xDown = clamp(xDown, 0, width);
265                        xUp = clamp(xUp, 0, width);
266                        yDown = clamp(yDown, 0, height);
267                        yUp = clamp(yUp, 0, height);
268                    }
269
270                    rim.add(new Point(xDown, center.y));
271                    rim.add(new Point(xUp, center.y));
272                    rim.add(new Point(center.x, yDown));
273                    rim.add(new Point(center.x, yUp));
274
275                    for (int i = xDown + 1, c = 1; i < center.x; i++, c++) {
276                        int x = i;
277                        if(!surpassEdges) x = clamp(i, 0, width);
278                        rim.add(new Point(x, clamp(center.y - c, 0, height)));
279                        rim.add(new Point(x, clamp(center.y + c, 0, height)));
280                    }
281                    for (int i = center.x + 1, c = 1; i < center.x + radiusLength; i++, c++) {
282                        int x = i;
283                        if(!surpassEdges) x = clamp(i, 0, width);
284                        rim.add(new Point(x, clamp(center.y + radiusLength - c, 0, height)));
285                        rim.add(new Point(x, clamp(center.y - radiusLength + c, 0, height)));
286                    }
287                }
288            }
289            break;
290            default:
291            {
292                double theta = PI2;
293                int x, y, denom = 1;
294                boolean anySuccesses = false;
295                while(denom <= 256) {
296                    anySuccesses = false;
297                    for (int i = 1; i <= denom; i+=2)
298                    {
299                        theta = i * (PI2 / denom);
300                        x = (int) Math.round(Math.cos(theta) * radiusLength) + center.x;
301                        y = (int) Math.round(Math.sin(theta) * radiusLength) + center.y;
302                        if (!surpassEdges) {
303                            x = clamp(x, 0, width);
304                            y = clamp(y, 0, height);
305                        }
306                        Point p = new Point(x, y);
307                        boolean test = rim.contains(p);
308
309                        rim.add(p);
310                        anySuccesses = test || anySuccesses;
311                    }
312                    if(!anySuccesses)
313                        break;
314                    denom *= 2;
315                }
316
317            }
318        }
319        return rim;
320    }
321    public Point extend(Point center, Point middle, int radiusLength, boolean surpassEdges, int width, int height)
322    {
323        if(!surpassEdges && (center.x < 0 || center.x >= width || center.y < 0 || center.y > height ||
324                middle.x < 0 || middle.x >= width || middle.y < 0 || middle.y > height))
325            return new Point(0, 0);
326        if(radiusLength < 1) {
327            return center;
328        }
329        double theta = Math.atan2(middle.y - center.y, middle.x - center.x);
330
331        Point end = new Point(middle.x, middle.y);
332        switch (this) {
333            case SQUARE:
334            case CUBE:
335            case DIAMOND:
336            case OCTAHEDRON:
337            {
338                int rad2 = 0;
339                if(surpassEdges)
340                {
341                    while (this.radius(center.x, center.y, end.x, end.y) < radiusLength) {
342                        rad2++;
343                        end.x = (int) Math.round(Math.cos(theta) * rad2) + center.x;
344                        end.y = (int) Math.round(Math.sin(theta) * rad2) + center.y;
345                    }
346                }
347                else {
348                    while (this.radius(center.x, center.y, end.x, end.y) < radiusLength) {
349                        rad2++;
350                        end.x = clamp((int) Math.round(Math.cos(theta) * rad2) + center.x, 0, width);
351                        end.y = clamp((int) Math.round(Math.sin(theta) * rad2) + center.y, 0, height);
352                        if (end.x == 0 || end.x == width - 1 || end.y == 0 || end.y == height - 1)
353                            return end;
354                    }
355                }
356
357                return end;
358            }
359            default:
360            {
361                end.x = (int) Math.round(Math.cos(theta) * radiusLength) + center.x;
362                end.y = (int) Math.round(Math.sin(theta) * radiusLength) + center.y;
363                if(!surpassEdges) {
364                    long edgeLength = 0;
365//                    if (end.x == 0 || end.x == width - 1 || end.y == 0 || end.y == height - 1)
366                    if (end.x < 0)
367                    {
368                        // wow, we lucked out here. the only situation where cos(angle) is 0 is if the angle aims
369                        // straight up or down, and then x cannot be < 0 or >= width.
370                        edgeLength = Math.round((0 - center.x) / Math.cos(theta));
371                        end.y = (int) Math.round(Math.sin(theta) * edgeLength) + center.y;
372                    }
373                    else if(end.x >= width)
374                    {
375                        // wow, we lucked out here. the only situation where cos(angle) is 0 is if the angle aims
376                        // straight up or down, and then x cannot be < 0 or >= width.
377                        edgeLength = Math.round((width - 1 - center.x) / Math.cos(theta));
378                        end.y = (int) Math.round(Math.sin(theta) * edgeLength) + center.y;
379                    }
380
381                    if (end.y < 0)
382                    {
383                        // wow, we lucked out here. the only situation where sin(angle) is 0 is if the angle aims
384                        // straight left or right, and then y cannot be < 0 or >= height.
385                        edgeLength = Math.round((0 - center.y) / Math.sin(theta));
386                        end.x = (int) Math.round(Math.cos(theta) * edgeLength) + center.x;
387                    }
388                    else if(end.y >= height)
389                    {
390                        // wow, we lucked out here. the only situation where sin(angle) is 0 is if the angle aims
391                        // straight left or right, and then y cannot be < 0 or >= height.
392                        edgeLength = Math.round((height - 1 - center.y) / Math.sin(theta));
393                        end.x = (int) Math.round(Math.cos(theta) * edgeLength) + center.x;
394                    }
395                    end.x = clamp(end.x, 0, width);
396                    end.y = clamp(end.y, 0, height);
397                }
398                return end;
399            }
400        }
401    }
402
403}
